email:
Subject: Application Questions for MSc in Software Engineering at UCL

Dear Admissions Team,

I hope this email finds you well. My name is John Doe, and I am a prospective student from [Country] interested in applying for the Master's degree program in Software Engineering at University College London (UCL).

I was hoping to clarify a few essential details before submitting my application. Could you please kindly assist me with the following questions?

1. As an international student, do I need to take a recognized English language proficiency test (e.g., IELTS or TOEFL) prior to applying for the MSc program in Software Engineering? If so, are there any specific scores required?
2. Can international students like myself work part-time during their studies at UCL? Are there any restrictions or guidelines that I should be aware of regarding employment during my graduate program?

Lastly,

3. Do I need to pay an application fee for each master's degree program that I apply to, including the MSc in Software Engineering? If so, what is the amount of the application fee and are there any exemptions available?

I would greatly appreciate it if you could provide me with the necessary information regarding these questions.

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to hearing from you soon. Please feel free to contact me at [john.doe@email.com](mailto:john.doe@email.com) or +[phone number] if you require any additional details.

Best regards,

John Doe

questions.question: Do I need to take a recognised English test before I apply for my graduate programme?
questions.answer: The required evidence should, if possible, be included with the complete application. However, you can submit your application before you have taken a test. If either unsatisfactory or no evidence of English language proficiency has been provided with the application, admission will be conditional upon the provision of such evidence. This condition will be clearly indicated on the offer letter and must be fulfilled before enrolment at UCL.

questions.question: I am an international student, can I work during my studies?
questions.answer:
In most cases, international students will hold a Student visa which will allow you to work in the UK during your studies. Please check your visa to confirm your permitted working hours.

Please note that if you are a part-time student, then you will not be permitted to work in the UK during your studies. If you are a student visitor, then you will not be permitted to work in the UK during your studies.

For more information about the working restrictions for international students, please contact the UCL Student Immigration Advice Team.

questions.question: Do I have to pay an application fee for each application I make?
questions.answer: Yes, if you apply for more than one programme the fee is payable for each application that requires an application fee.
